block.p: Emma Fukumura and Mark Christopher Fosshage were married yesterday at the Sagamore Resort in Bolton Landing, N.Y. The Rev. Dawn Wood, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Fosshage, 30, is the senior media planner at Bloomingdale's, the department store in New York. She graduated cum laude from Syracuse University. She is a daughter of Kyoko and Bin Fukumura of Tokyo. Her father works in Tokyo as a senior vice president for marketing for the AIU Insurance Company, a unit of American International Group.
Emma Fukumura and Mark Christopher Fosshage were married yesterday at the Sagamore Resort in Bolton Landing, N.Y. The Rev. Dawn Wood, a United Methodist minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Fosshage, 30, is the senior media planner at Bloomingdale's, the department store in New York. She graduated cum laude from Syracuse University. She is a daughter of Kyoko and Bin Fukumura of Tokyo. Her father works in Tokyo as a senior vice president for marketing for the AIU Insurance Company, a unit of American International Group.

Mr. Fosshage, 30, is the president of World Water Works, a manufacturer of water treatment equipment in Edgewater, N.J. He graduated from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. He is the son of Judith Fosshage and Dr. James Fosshage of Demarest, N.J. His mother is an interior designer at Roberta Washington Architects in New York and also a freelance designer. His father is a psychologist and psychoanalyst with practices in Englewood, N.J., and New York. He is also a clinical professor of psychology at New York University and a founder of the National Institute for the Psychotherapies in New York.
